reviews.text: I just recently returned from a 2 week vacation to Australia. We booked thru Azumano Travel, Portland, OR (they are great!!). I usually do all the planning myself but there were 9 of us and I needed help. We chose the Quay West Suites for its location and availability for 4 rooms. We were not planning on renting a car and wanted to be near the transportation hub. Only a short walk to a ferry, the busses or the trains. We spent 5 nights here.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from all of our rooms were wonderful. I can't say enough. I had a room for 3 people (and we had 3 one bedroom rooms) and had the exact view I found when browsing the online information. We looked out over Sydney Harbor, Harbor Bridge and the Opera House. We had a full kitchen, laundry in room and lots of space (we had a 2 bedroom suite) with two bathrooms.
reviews.title: This is definitely the place to be.

likes.liked: — The view, the staff, standard of room.

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and well stocked. The carpet was a little worn but no smoke smells or other irritants. The staff was always available to answer questions and help in any way. No waits!
reviews.title: Absolutely georgeous!!!

likes.liked: — Hotel room view from our suite!! Size and accomodations of the room.
likes.disliked: — Vegemite at the buffet breakfast!! (if I had to pick something!!)

reviews.text: There is a restaurant downstairs (Harrington) that we tried twice for breakfast. It was less than impressive. The first breakfast we had there was "just okay". The 2nd day my omelette was not completely done in the middle. There were a few issues from others in the party. We found everything in Sydney to be very expensive. There was a restaurant across the street called "Jacksons". Great food and better prices. Their staff was friendly and fun!! We ate there several times but also found many other worthy places to eat.
reviews.title: Go for the view alone

reviews.text: I would definitely consider staying here again. As an aside..we were limited as to when we could go. There are less people at this time of the year but there can be lots of rain. Warm but wet!
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
No compassion or understanding for changes of booking dates
reviews.text: We were very disappointed to hear this hotel is not very compassionate about guest who need to make changes to their booking due to extreme circumstances.

Our situation has us caught up in the Bangkok protest meaning we are not able to get to the hotel as we originally thought. We attempt to call them up to 'change' our booking dates and not cancel it and advise them we are stuck with no other alternative. They were quick to shrug off our desperate request. We understand of their No Cancellation Policies and we accept this, but we are not trying to cancel, but merely just change our dates.
reviews.title: Good choice for extended stay with family

likes.liked: — Lots of space in the rooms
likes.disliked: — Wear and tear and street noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the rates charge per night, I think they could have been a little accomodating. So basically our hard earned money put towards this hotel has been forfeit due to the lack of understanding by this hotel. Again we stress, we did not want to cancel as we still wanted to stay at the hotel, only just change as we are currently still stuck in Bangkok till the airports are re open.
reviews.title: Great for a longer stay

likes.liked: — The space and layout of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Quay West in October for one week.
reviews.title: Fantastic service & location!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and pool and spa

reviews.text: Arrived via taxi and baggage was immediately taken and delivered to the room. Hotel was quiet and check-in was very quick. Our room, 1003 was a nicely sized one bedroom apartment. Room looked to be in good shape (little wear and tear). We had a partial view of the harbour, mostly of the city.
reviews.title: Great Family Choice in Sydney

reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Quay West Suites. My 3 sisters & I took Mum to Sydney for her 70th birthday. It was also the year of her 50th wedding anniversary and Sydney was where my parents honeymooned, so she had not been back for that long !!!
reviews.title: Wow...what a view !!!

likes.liked: — The fantastic view from the room

reviews.text: We had a fantastic 2 bdrm Harbour View suite on 17th floor. The view was breathtaking overlooking Harbour Bridge & Opera House. At night we left the blinds open to watch the lights.
reviews.title: Ideal location on the Rocks

reviews.text: Location is great, a very short walk to Circular Quay to catch transport and walking to shops & restaurants at The Rocks.
reviews.title: Fantastic views and location

reviews.text: The suite was equipped with everything we needed, kitchen, laundry, 2 bathrooms, lounge area & dining area. Rooms were clean and beds reasonable comfortable. We had no problems with all 5 of us fitting into the suite comfortably.
reviews.title: 5 star accommodation - a let down

reviews.text: The hotel has a great pool on 24th floor, again with great views towards the harbour & city. The pool is heated and has a great big window at the side where you can see underwater !!! It also has a small gym, spa and sauna.
reviews.title: Great break away

likes.liked: — Location, The pool is pretty special and the views are amazing

reviews.text: I checked out of Shangri La to stay at this place, and really wished I had stayed here the entire 30+night stay in Sydney. The hotel is in the Rocks area, sandwiched between two streets, which makes it SUPER QUIET. It is hard to find, as the back entrance is off Harrington street. Full laundry, dishwasher, oven, microwave, fridge, yet maid service, mini bar, etc. Everything anyone needs is at this hotel, including room service. Why eat in the room, though? We brought water, soda, Arnott's cookies , etc to the room and really had peace and quiet. The views were amazing as well. Not once did we hear other people. There are very few rooms on the floors. The residents live in the high floors. We loved this place. My biggest complaint, however, is they changed the rates on us after we booked the place. I really had to argue with them about this. I suggest getting your rates PER NIGHT in writing 100%. They upped our rates on various nights by $69 AUD. I had to speak to the manager, as I felt scammed. They ended up finally just increasing it by $19 on various nights. How can a place get away with this? We were told our rate was $159 per night for 7 nights. When we checked out, some of the nights were $180, $205, $169.. very strange--WHAT A SCAM, and WHAT UTTER BS. Other than this, we loved the staff, the hotel, the convenience of being so close to everything, yet blocks away from the noise. We would return here, but would simply request the nightly rate--BY DATE-- in writing. The hotel does not have the service of Shangri La, but feels more like "home" to people. LCD TVs in the living room, bedroom also, nice bathroom, Bliss shower products, dish soap, laundry soap. Doing laundry while traveling is a nice convenience and this alone makes this place worth staying. Even if there is noise, which we did not hear, you can turn up the air such that it is loud. DSL, etc for a price, pay per view, etc. Staff was really nice here also. Did not care for the changing rates.. I am really not sure how the hotel can get away with this when they do not appear to disclose this with guests--they maybe forgot to do this with just us? Doubtful.
reviews.title: Not just a hotel.. more like an apartment with privacy and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Quay West Suites facing the harbour boasts spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Unfortunately, the 5-star rating of this hotel ends there. Service at this hotel was poor, and certainly not up the the standard of a luxury hotel. The in-house restaurant is only open on Fridays...any meals taken at other times are solely via room service, which also happens to incur a $5 service charge. When orders come, they arrive with mistakes, and the standard of the cuisine is mediocre (though why you would want to eat in-doors being so central is another matter). Serious room faults were repeatedly reported, but never acted upon by front desk staff; the severity of the problem was only acknowledged when we were checked out by a more senior member of staff. The promise of a suite upgrade on a future visit however, is somewhat wanting. During our stay, the swimming pool, spa and gym facilities were being upgraded, though check-in staff neglected to in form us of this...would anyone have checked into a 5 star hotel knowing this? The hotel is well located in the Harbour area, though the standard of the hotel itself was inadequate, as were the facilities and usefulness of the staff. Book a suite if you want a room with a view; go elsewhere if you want the 5-star experience.
reviews.title: Nice view, shame about the hotel

reviews.text: We had a two-bedroom suite with an absolutely amazing harbor view. Imagine walking into your hotel room and seeing the Sydney Harbor Bridge and Opera House out your room window!
reviews.title: Room with a view but a possible security issue
Excellent value
reviews.text: Window opens slightly, no balcony. Laundry facilities in the room. Two bathrooms with a kitchen area. There's a mini bar and an empty refrig for your personal use. Includes microwave oven. Comfortable and clean. We were on the 23rd floor which is the same floor as the indoor pool and fitness area. Can't comment on the hotel food because we didn't eat there. Staff was helpful. We did not rent a car. We were able to walk to all of the important sites. This hotel would have received a higher rating from us had it not been for the following.....

Strange encounter: Don't mean to sound paranoid but we thought it strange when we we returned to our room in the late morning "unexpectedly" and found our room door inoperable. It had been bolted from the interior. We persisted only because we had had a room key issue earlier and were shocked to have a man open our room door. Although he was in a maintenance-type uniform and had a tool box, he was in our room and had bolted the door. He immediately said, "Oh, your heat is fixed." This was really strange because we hadn't reported any heat issues. He immediately left. In retrospect, we realize this should have been reported to hotel management. None of our valuables were missing but we had only been out of the room for a short time before we returned.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel
